course_title: Special Topics: Film and Media: Global Digital Activism
seats: Seats: Maximum Enrollment: 25 / Seats Avail: 21Waitlist Total: 0
class_notes:
Additional Prereq of FILM 102, please reach out to Ale Perozo Borges (alejandra.perozo@emory.edu) with your 7-digit ID for a permission number.


This course explores the influence of digital media on the shape and reach of global activism, with a focus on East Asia. The goal is for students to develop a critical understanding of the nature of contemporary activism associated with the use of digital media technologies and its implications for global social change.
course_description: Rotating topics in film and media. May be repeated for credit when the topic varies.
prerequisites: FILM 101 or FILM_OX 101 or equivalent transfer credit as prerequisite.
schedule_location: MW 2:30pm-3:45pm in Math & Science Center - W307C
sections: Class Nbr: 3474, Section #: 3, Type: LEC, Campus: ATL, Meets: MW 2:30-3:45p, Instructor: J. Kim, Status: Open
